intro: Decaphalangium peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Decaphalangium peruvianum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional Andean medicine.
